title: NEBNext Direct® Genotyping Solution 3/4: Bead Binding, Ligation, and Amplification
author: Opentrons
description:
Links:
 Part 1: Sample Prep Kit and Hybridization
 Part 2: Streptavidin Bead Preparation
 Part 3: Bead Binding, Ligation, and Amplification
 Part 4: Purify and Size Select Amplified Fragments
With this protocol, your robot is capable to perform the NEBNext Direct® Genotyping Solution Panels protocol, as described by the New England BioLabs Instructional Manual.
This is part 3 of the protocol, which includes (1.8.) Bead Binding, (1.9.) 3' Blunting of DNA, (1.10.) 3' Adaptor Ligation, (1.11.) Off-Target Removal, and (1.12.) Library Amplification.
Make sure to review the instructional manual before proceeding to confirm kit contents and make sure you have the required equipment and consumables. See Additional Notes below for reagent setup and more details about this protocol.
This protocol starts at step 1.8.4. and ends at 1.12.2, you have to manually perform steps 1.8.1-1.8.3 on a thermocycler, as well as 1.12.3-1.12.6. After the manual steps, you can safely store the PCR reactions with beads for up to 24 hours at 4°C.

You will need:
 P10 Multi-channel Pipette
 P300 Single-channel Pipette
 Temperature Module
 Magnetic Module
 4-in-1 Tube Rack Set
 FrameStar Skirted 96-well PCR Plate
 10 uL Tip Racks
 Opentrons 300 uL Tip Racks
process:
Input the desired engage height for your Magnetic Module. (see Additional Notes below)
Download your protocol.
Upload your protocol into the OT App.
Set up your deck according to the deck map.
Calibrate your labware, tiprack and pipette using the OT App. For calibration tips, check out our support article.
Hit "Run".
notes:
Reagent Setup:


Deck Setup:

Follow Deck Config 1 to set up your deck before the start of the protocol. Throughout the protocol, the deck configurations may change when protocol is paused. Make sure to read the instructions on the OT App to see which configuration to follow.



Engage Height:

You might need to modify the Magnetic Module engage height based on the labware you are placing on top. To find the right engage height for your labware, plug the Magnetic Module in the robot, and place the labware on the module. Download and run this script. You can skip calibration and go directly to "RUN". If the engage height (default: 14.94 mm) is too high or too low, feel free to adjust the number in line 8 in the script. Re-run the script with thew new engage height until you find the perfect height for your labware. You can then modify the Magnetic Module engage height for your protocol in the input field above before downloading your protocol.

If you have any questions about this protocol, please contact protocols@opentrons.com.
